etymology.description: 练(練) + 习(習) = train/refine + practice/learn → practice; drill.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the notion of refining skill with repeated learning, stressing repeated training to gain proficiency. Conveys a process of honing through habitual exercise.
etymology.simplification: 練 → 练: 糸 simplified to 纟 and the component 柬 replaced by phonetic 东; 習 → 习: the complex wing-feather form was compressed to a single, streamlined shape to reduce strokes.

parts.english: to practice; to train; to refine; to temper
to practice; to study; habit; to get used to

examples.chinese: 我每天练习口语(我每天練習口語)。
比赛前(比賽前)，我们多练习几遍(我們多練習幾遍)。
examples.pinyin: Bǐsài qián, wǒmen duō liànxí jǐ biàn.
examples.english: Before the competition, we practice several more times.

examples.chinese: 通过反复练习(通過反覆練習)，技巧会越来越熟练(技巧會越來越熟練)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò fǎnfù liànxí, jìqiǎo huì yuè lái yuè shúliàn.
examples.english: Through repeated practice, skills become more and more proficient.
